newsitem.title: USA: J&J unit to distribute Selfcare system.
newsitem.headline: J&J unit to distribute Selfcare system.

text.p: Selfcare Inc said it formed an agreement with Johnson & Johnson Inc unit LifeScan Inc for LifeScan to distribute an advanced version of Selfcare's blood glucose monitoring system.
Under the deal, LifeScan paid Selfcare a $7 million success fee, and a LifeScan affiliate converted its existing loans of about $13.7 million into 201,622 shares of Selfcare common stock.

The LifeScan affiliate would also receive more shares equal to 5 percent of all common stock issued by Selfcare for options and warrants outstanding as of November 10, 1995. Selfcare said it estimated the LifeScan affiliate would ultimately receive about 278,800 additional shares.
Selfcare said the advanced version of the proprietary electrochemical monitoring system still needed U.S. Food and Drug Administration clearance before it could be sold in the United States.
The company already received FDA clearance for prior version of the system.
